column2: IP
Submission ID
Submission Date
What is the name of your business?
Street Address
Street Address Line 2
City
State / Province
Postal / Zip Code
Country
What is the phone number for your business?
What is the website address for your business?
When did you first start your business?
What type of business do you have?
What is the legal status of your business?
Is this a new start up or an established business?
Who is the primary contact?
What is the best phone number for the primary contact?
What is the email for the primary contact?
Section 2 Business Preparation
Do you currently have a Vision Statement for your business?
Do you currently have a Mission Statement for your business?
Have you created a Business Model for your business?
Have you created a Financial Model for your business?
Have you created a Product/Service Pricing Model for your business?
Have you created a Go-To-Market Strategy for your business
Have you created a One-Page Investor Summary for your business
Have you created a Private Placement memorandum (PPM) for your business
Have you created a Forward Looking (Save Harbor) Statement for your business
Is your business currently generating revenue?
If not, how long do you predict it will take to get there?
What are some of the key problems you see with your business right now? (Select all that apply)
End of 2 Summary
Section 3 - Ownership Structure
Are you the sole owner of your business?
Is there someone else you need to get approval from to make business decisions?
Are you or any other owners of your company women, minorities, veterans or a disabled veteran?
Is there stock set aside for future investors and/or employees?
Have you established any strategic alliances or partners?
End of 3 Summary
Section 4 - Business Funding Position
Looking generally at your business, how would you describe its financial position? (select all that apply)
How has the business been financed to date? (select all that apply)
How much money have you and other founders invested in the business to date?
Are you looking to attract additional investment funds?
If so, how much are you looking to raise?
What do you need the money for? (select all that apply)?
How much do you presently have in immediately available funds, either already in the business or to inject into the business?
End of 4 Summary
Section 5 - Business Milestone Achievements
What Milestones have been achieved to date? (Check all that apply)
What Milestones are currently in the pipeline? (Check all that apply)
How are you performing toward those milestone achievements?
Are the people in place to help meet these milestones?
What is your exit strategy?
End of 5 Summary
Section 6 - Business Structure & Organization
Is this a home office company or will  you need additional office space?
How many people do you employ in total?
How many people will you employ at full growth?
Do you have an HR department internally, or is it outsourced?
Is there a defined culture within your organization?
Do you have a high turnover of employees?
Do you have issues with team engagement among employees?
Have you developed a policies and procedures manual?
Do you have job descriptions in place for employees?
Do you have an official review/discipline process in place?
Do you have an active employee benefits plan in place?
Do you have an IT department internally, or is it outsourced?
Will you be seeking to hire new employees over next 12 months?
Have you used external consultants to date?
Would you consider using part-time consultants to fulfill some of the key functions within the company?
What skill gaps do you currently feel you need to fill in order to grow your business? (Check all that apply)
End of 6 Summary
Section 7 - Executive Management Team
Do you have Executives other than yourself?
What key executive functions are currently in place? (Check all that apply)
Have any of your  Key Executives previously had successful business ventures?
Do any of the Key Executives have Founder shares in the business?
Have any of the Key Executives invested into the business?
Are all executive team members direct employees of the business?
Do you have a Board of Directors?
Do you have an Advisory Board?
Do you have external professional advisors, consultants or coaches in any specific area of activity?
End of 7 Summary
Section 8 - Products or Services
What do you sell?
How do you characterize your business?
If you are a service oriented business, are you the provider/creator of your service?
If you are a product oriented business, are you the manufacturer of your product?
Do you have an existing Minimal Viable Product (MVP) for your business
What is your expectation of Net Profit before Taxes?
Would your products/services be considered "must haves" or "like to haves"
Do you have to drive demand or does the market take care of it?
End of 8 Summary
Section 9 - Intellectual Property
Do you have any proprietary technology or manufacturing processes?
Do you have any patents, copyrights or trademarks filed or pending?
Are you satisfied that your IP is being protected at the manufacturing level?
Do you work with an established IP attorney?
Do you suffer any issues with regard to IP infringement?
Do you suffer problems with counterfeit products competing with you in the market?
End of 9 Summary
Section 10 - Scalability
Where are your products/services currently being sold?
Is your business model one which will enable you to significantly scale up your business?
How do you see the future for your business?
How long before  you see yourself becoming profitable?
Are you exploiting the company’s full potential for “Geographical” scalaability?
Would you consider setting up a physical presence in overseas markets?
Are you exploiting the company’s full potential for “Market” scalability?
Are you exploiting the company’s full potential for “Product scalability"?
End of 10 Summary
Section 11 - Revenue
Do you currently have more than ONE revenue stream?
Are you planning to increase the number of revenue streams?
Are your sales patterns consistent or cyclical?
Are you happy with the performance of all the revenue streams?
How realistic is it to develop additional revenue streams? (on a scale of 1 to 5)
What are the limiting factors for developing additional revenue streams?(Check all that apply)
End of 11 Sumary
Section 12 - Sales
Where are your sales made?
Have you developed revenue projections for the next 2-3 years?
How frequently do you track your performance against these projections?
Have you developed revenue projections for the next 3-5 years?
Do you have an internal sales force?
How many people in the company are responsible for making sales?
Are your salespeople full-time or part-time?
Do you have an established sales process in place?
How are your sales personnel compensated? (Check all that apply)
Is your sales team meeting defined goals?
Do you have an in-house sales training program?
Do your field sales people also manage ongoing customer relationships?
How long is the sales cycle?
Do you export/work internationally?
End of 12 Summary
Section 13 - Customer Identification
What percentage of your total sales is generated by your top 5 customers?
How would you describe your target customer list?
How would you describe your target market?
Do you have a clear profile of your ideal customer?
Are your customers readily accessible geographically?
Are your customers readily accessible digitally?
Do you have previous experience successfully selling other products/services to this customer set?
How would you rate your customer relations overall?
Do you get referral business from existing customers?
End of 13 Summary
Section 14 - Market Dynamics
How well defined is the size of your market on a scale of 1 to 5?
Do you consider your company to have an established presence in its markets?
How well do you feel you have penetrated those markets?
Have you conducted a Strengths, Weakness, Opportunities and Threats (S.W.O.T.) analysis on your business
Have you identified your primary competitive advantage?
Do you have a plan to overcome your competitive disadvantages?
Do you have serious competition?
Are they powerhouse companies with massive resources you cannot match?
How do your competitors see you in your markets?
Do you have a handle on market trends effecting your business?
Do these represent opportunities or threats to the business in the future?
Is your market need well-known, or will you be required to educate your market as to the problem the need solved first?
End of 14 Summary
Section 15 - Marketing
Does your company have a dominant brand identity?
Does your company have registered domain names to support its market presence?
Does your company have a professionally designed brand logo?
Do your products/services have clear brand identities?
How do you perceive your company's image today?
If rated low, do you know why?
Have you made efforts to strengthen your image in the past 12 months?
Do you have a marketing strategy incorporated into a Marketing Plan?
How often is this marketing strategy revisited and updated?
Do you have an identified marketing budget?
What percentage of total gross revenue is attributed to marketing
Do you have anyone specifically in charge of marketing in-house or outside?
Is there a corporate focus on the marketing of the company?
What are the different channels you use to promote the business currently? (Check all that apply)
Are you active on social media?
Do you have in-house expert on social media or is it outsourced?
Are your customers on social media?
End of 15 Summary
Section 16 - Financial Management
Have you been actively maintaining ongoing record keeping for financial purposes?
Do you have internal bookkeeping capabilities?
Do you have internal accounting staff or is it out-sourced?
Do you employ an external CPA or accountant to prepare tax returns?
Do you feel you have liquidity issues or cash flow problems?
Do you have the bank facilities and relationships in place to support cash flows?
Does the company carry any debt? (excluding equity investors)
If so, how much?
Are you happy with your current banking relationship?
Is your company profitable?
Have you reached breakeven?
Are you able to determine if all your product or service lines make money?
How closely do you monitor cash flows?
Do you have an internal financial management system that you use?
Does your company produce annual budgets?
Do you produce regular cash flow forecasts?
If so, how accurate have they proven to be to date?
Do you compare your actual performance against your forecasts?
Are all your taxes filed up to date?
End of 16 Summary
Section 17 - Pricing Models
Does the company have robust pricing models for all its products?
Do you have a clear idea of your unit costs of production?
Are you selling to wholesalers/ retailers/ public directly? (Check all that apply)
Is your pricing model dictated by competition or by profit goals?
If product based, do you offer value-added “services” in addition to the company’s offerings?
End Section 17 Summary
Section 18 - Cost Controls
Do you consider you have a cost problem generally?
If so, do you know where problem lies?
Have you tried or been able to do anything positive to turn these problems around?
Do you have any systems in place to control costs?
Is there a cost control culture within your company?
End Section 18 Summary
Section 19 - Production
Are you a Manufacturing Company?
Where are your products manufactured?
Are you satisfied with your manufacturing operations?
Do you suffer from quality control issues?
If manufacturing overseas, do you have a local rep looking after you?
Are you always able to fulfill orders on time?
Are you satisfied with your costs of production?
Do you have problems sourcing supplies and raw materials?
How much control do you have over the manufacturing process?
Do you receive satisfactory credit terms from your suppliers?
Are you normally able to pay creditors on time?
Are you governed by Health & Safety or other regulatory matters?
Are you in compliance with all appropriate regulations and laws?
Are your company’s internal production processes robust?
How engaged is  your company regarding new product development?
Is anyone responsible for new product development?
End Section 19 Summary
Section 20 - Personal Assessment
Are you permanently stressed out due to work issues?
What stressors seem to keep you up at night? (Check all that apply
Do you feel your life/work balance is skewed in the wrong direction?
Are you ever able to take time out to recharge?
Do you have a team in place to fill in gaps when you are away?
Do you feel the company can operate effectively in your absence?
Do you have "Key Person" Insurance or some protective measure in place if you should become incapacitated?
Are you able to pay yourself what you think you’re worth?
On an hourly basis, are you the best or worst paid person in your company?
Do you have a “Legacy” plan in place for your business?
Do you have a successor in mind?
If so, is your successor being groomed to take over?
Looking at your overall feelings about becoming a business owner, which answer best sums up your feelings?
End Section 20 Summary
Section 21 - General
Do you see any of the following looming external threats happening that could upset your business? (Check all that apply)
Are there any internal weakness or threats that could hinder your growth as a company? (Check all that apply)
Do you see any changes externally that could create great opportunities for growth?
Do you feel you already have the internal resources to exploit those opportunities?
How Close is the Company to reaching it's full potential as it is right now?
Would it require a significant capital injection to take it to another level?
Would it require an enhanced team to take it there?
End of Section 21 Summary
Section Title
Foundational Structure (Sections 2, 3, 5, 6 & 7)
Financial Position (Sections 4, 8, 11, 12, 16, 17 & 18)
Sales/Marketing (Sections 10, 12, 13, 14 & 15)
Product/Service (Sections 8, 9 & 19)
General (Sections 20 & 21)
